item.title: Research
item.description: My research revolves around issues on the accumulation of human capital and the functioning of labor markets in low and middle income countries. Working Papers Enhancing Human Capital in Children. A Case Study on Scaling (with Francesco Agostinelli and Ciro Avitabile). Revise and Resubmit (fourth round), Journal of Political Economy. VoxDev Column. Teacher Compensation and Structural Inequality: Evidence from Centralized Teacher School Choice in Peru (with Tim Ederer, Gianmarco LÃ©on-Ciliotta, Chris Neilson, and Marco Nieddu).

I am a Professor of Economics at the Toulouse School of Economics (TSE) in France. My academic research focuses on topics in Development, Labor, and Public Economics. I am also interested in methodological aspects of Policy Evaluation, and in particular in combining model-based and design-based approaches. Prior to my academic career, I have been an Economist at the Inter-American Development Bank in Washington DC. I am a Research Fellow at the CEPR (Development and Labor), IZA, and EUDN.
